info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 3:02PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern McDowell and northwestern Burke Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 302 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Spruce Pine, or 5 miles south of Linville Falls, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Linville Falls, B.R. Parkway-Linville Falls To Grandfather, Ashford, Jonas Ridge and North Cove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
